Package ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.completion

Class DefaultCodeAlternative

java.lang.Object
ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.completion.CodeAlternative
ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.completion.DefaultCodeAlternative
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<CodeAlternative>
public class DefaultCodeAlternative extends CodeAlternative
A default implementation of CodeAlternative. A code alternative represents one possible option for completing a code fragment. Code alternatives are generated on demand by a CodeCompleter.
Since:
3.0

  • Constructor Details

    • DefaultCodeAlternative

      public DefaultCodeAlternative​(JSourceCodeEditor target, String description, Icon icon, int prefixLength)
      Creates a new code alternative with no category, at scope depth 0, and with a default prefix length. The inserted text will be identical to the description. The use of prefix length is described in the description of the full constructor.
      Parameters:
      target - the editor that the alternative applies to
      description - the text to display to the user to describe the alternative
      icon - an icon representing the type of entity being inserted
      prefixLength - the number of characters already typed by the user

    • DefaultCodeAlternative

      public DefaultCodeAlternative​(JSourceCodeEditor target, String textToInsert, String description, String category, Icon icon, int scope, boolean chained, int prefixLength)
      Creates a new code alternative.

      Note that the text to insert should include the characters implied by the prefix length. That is, the text to insert should include the part already typed by the user. This is because these characters will be replaced when code is inserted; this allows code completion to be case insensitive. For example, if the user had typed "gam" and completion was "GAMMA", "GAMMA" would be passed as the text to insert and the prefix length would be set to 3 because the user already typed 3 characters. On completion, these three characters would be deleted, and then GAMMA inserted in full.

      Parameters:
      target - the editor that the alternative applies to
      textToInsert - the text to insert if the alternative is selected
      description - the text to display to the user to describe the alternative
      category - a general category for the type of entity being inserted
      icon - an icon representing the type of entity being inserted
      scope - an integer indicating the scope depth (use 0 for default)
      chained - if true, and this alternative is selected, a code completion command will be executed again in the editor immediately
      prefixLength - the number of characters already typed by the user; typically this is description.length()-textToInsert.length()

      public void apply()
      Description copied from class: CodeAlternative
      Applies this code alternative in the editor for which it was created. This alternative will be used to complete code at the insertion point.

    • isChained

      public boolean isChained()
      Description copied from class: CodeAlternative
      Returns true if this completion should chain to another completion. If this returns true, and this completion is applied, then the user should immediately be prompted with another completion opportunity.
      Specified by:
      isChained in class CodeAlternative
      Returns:
      true if this completion should lead to another

    • getScope

      public int getScope()
      Description copied from class: CodeAlternative
      Returns a scope index for the alternative. The scope value is used to sort alternatives into groups; the higher the scope, the closer the entry will be to the top of the list of alternatives presented to the user.
      Specified by:
      getScope in class CodeAlternative
      Returns:
      a scope value for the alternative

      Returns:

    • getPrefixLength

      public int getPrefixLength()
      Description copied from class: CodeAlternative
      Returns the number of characters that this completion has in common with the already present text. For example, if the editor contains the text "he" and the code completion is "hello", then this should return 2.
      Specified by:
      getPrefixLength in class CodeAlternative
      Returns:
      the length of the prefix that this alternative completes
